alert.note: Alert for East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:54PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Goshen and northeastern Platte Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 454 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Laramie National Historic Site, or 23 miles northwest of Torrington, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lingle, Fort Laramie and Fort Laramie National Historic Site. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.
